thread.title: Super Bowl halftime show features hundreds of shining drones
thread.title_full: Super Bowl halftime show features hundreds of shining drones

author: Helena Horton
title: Super Bowl halftime show features hundreds of shining drones
text:
T he Super Bowl halftime show featured a dazzling display of drones.
The drones ducked and dived around the Houston skyline, transforming from stars to a flag.
300 of the flying machines all traveled across the sky in sync.
The drones were Intel's Shooting Star Drone Squad. 
Our drones have returned to the ground after an amazing #PepsiHalftime show #ExperienceMore pic.twitter.com/Augpbt05u6 
— Intel (@intel) February 6, 2017 A lthough this was almost certainly their largest audience, they have been seen before.
The set of drones recently finished a three-week run at Disney World, in Sydney last year 500 synchronised drones et the world record for most unmanned aerial vehicles airborne simultaneously.
According to Intel, the drones can create more than more than 4 billion colour combinations.
Watch | Super Bowl LI: Lady Gaga's epic halftime show jump 00:59 “Lady Gaga and the Super Bowl creative team wanted to pull off something that had never been done before and we were able to combine Intel drone innovation with her artistry to pull off a truly unique experience,” Josh Walden, general manager of Intel’s New Technology Group, said in a statement.
“The potential for these light show drones is endless and we hope this experience inspires other creatives, artists and innovators to really think about how they can incorporate drone technology in new ways that have yet to even be thought of.”
